intro: Flaveria kochiana, commonly known as the silverleaf flaveria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and hairy foliage. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters, known as capitula. Flaveria kochiana is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
